title: When are we going to get some way of dealing with champion select trolls in a promotion series game?
body:
As the title suggests, it is so incredibly frustrating being at the mercy of someone with zero empathy deciding they want to ruin your series game and having no way to deal with it (barring reporting them after the game, which is hardly a solution). I don't care so much about losing 3 LP from a normal dodge but the potential of being held hostage in a series games is ridiculous. I only had enough time for one crack at my promotion series to platinum the night that the queues were closing and the first game was a complete wash due to end-of-season trolls.

The suggestion of being able to vote-kick people in champion select has been around forever and hasn't really moved forward due to potential abuse cases but something of the sort should **really** be available if a player on your team is in a series game. An alternative, like having the ability to disband a champion select (provided you are in a set of series games) once for a given series would be such a relief.

**EDIT: Some suggestions that have come up from other players:**

**A means to deal with malicious players in champion select:**
1.) The ability to earn "dodges" by playing a set number of ranked games without dodging. This isn't without problems - we know that Riot never wants to encourage leaving games, but we can't be blamed for wanting a legitimate way to be able to leave a series game when we get an allied player who has been going 0/20 all day with {{summoner:10}} {{summoner:12}} {{champion:11}} 

**General Champion Select improvements:**
1.) Being able to re-queue up with a team that you'd been matched with, in the event that the lobby is dissolved by a dodge.

2.) Reduce randomness in pick order for a player is dodging. An clear abuse case in dodging is doing so in order to get a higher place on the pick order - a player should not be abusing the system to avoid taking their turn at being last pick.

3.) A report button available in champion select. **Yes please.** This would of course have to be heavily scrutinized. A report shouldn't count against you for something like a rare/unconventional champion pick.

**4.) Only match players who are in their series with other players who are in series games.** Everyone should go in with something personal on the line. Longer queue times would be worth the guarantee that everyone is in these tense games and (probably in most cases) will try harder as a result.

replies.body:
I've previously suggested earning free dodges every x completed Games without a Dodge. So if you enter and play 5 Games in a row without dodging you earn 1 Dodge for example,  with a cap on how many dodges you can hold. 

Cost of dodging without using a free Dodge would be higher for normal (non promo) ranked Games,  such as 15-20lp, dodging a promo without a free Dodge would be the same cost,  and if you have a free Dodge there is no penalty to dodging (apart from using the Dodge and resetting your game counter to earning a new Dodge). 

Players could then Dodge promos if they have proven they don't Dodge for silly reasons by playing consecutive Games to earn the dodges. The time penalty could either still apply or not. 

I honestly think this would work,  you'd feel a lot more in control of these things.  The rate of earning dodges and the cap on Saved ones could be balanced to prevent dodging becoming too common (if anything people would Dodge less because they want to earn dodges for real trolls,  and dodging without a free Dodge is similar to a full loss).

The idea of 'earning' dodges is very cool and definitely deals with a lot of abuse cases. I would happily take the potential of huge dodge penalties when you don't have a free dodge available if it meant being able to earn one for a case like needing one in a series game.

Exactly,  me too :)

I think part of why these issues arise is because you can't Dodge in a series but you're queued with people who can. So riot argues that you have a better than 50% chance of the troll being on the other team (5 opponents,  4 teammates) but really the troll could have been on the other team 3 times and just got dodged (you don't win a promo game by having the enemy Dodge! ) and then when he gets to your team you can't Dodge or you lose (so unless a teammate dodges you're stuck). 

The system needs to be more symmetric in order for it to work.

Earning dodges is a terrible idea, because it'll get treated like ARAM's rerolls - if you don't get the team you want, you dodge. If you get counterpicked, you dodge. It's free, no problem.

It actually helps trolls and bullies get what they want, because if they don't, they'll just dodge. Fifth pick and can't get mid no matter how you threaten to troll? Dodge.

And it'll make the time spent waiting to get into a game so much longer, because so many games will just be disbanded due to free dodges.

It's a terrible idea. We need better ones.

--

**A report button in Champ Select **might help. There's not a lot of gameplay ways to disrupt it, at most you can pick stupid Spells, troll with you champion pick, and misbehave in chat, but that's it. Riot already collects logs from Champ Select, they just weren't included in the Tribunal, probably because people there refer to players by their summoner names rather than champion names, and Riot wants the players to be anonymous while being judged.

Making sure players know the Champ Select **chat is logged and can be read by Riot** might help. Getting this across to all players is pretty much impossible, but a loading screen tip mentioning it would reach a lot of players.

While not a solution to the problem in Champ Select, it's a common source of frustration: You get a good team, and someone on the other team dodges, and your good team is gone. **Being able to stay on the same team, where you might have agreed on roles and positions**, might help.

**Keeping the Pick Order** would reduce the reward from dodging or getting someone to dodge. If someone wants mid but is fifth pick, they can dodge, or  threaten to troll so that someone else dodges, and get a higher pick in next Champ Select. This is not good, it's abuse of the system, and should be addressed. It would reduce the incentive to induce a dodge in the team - in other words, reduce trolling that's used to get a higher pick/your preferred role.

--

I have a long thread on EUNE's Player Behavior forum where I've thought about these things and my experience with problems primarily in Champ Select. Now that the season's over, I could go over my thread and dig up all the ideas I've had for this.

> Being able to stay on the same team, where you might have agreed on roles and positions, might help.

That's an awesome idea. There could be some sort of flag you can mark in your lobby that says something like "If this lobby is disbanded, I would like to requeue with these players if they are available."

In regards to your other concerns - couldn't that be solved with a combination of it being difficult to earn dodges and a low cap on how many you can have at one time? Maybe also a longer dodge timer? Obviously it wouldn't make sense to earn them as quickly as ARAM rerolls because there's so much at stake. They would need to be unavailable enough that it's not feasible to take a "mid or dodge" approach, as you mentioned.

As someone who is pretty quick to dodge if I don't like the look of a team comp or whatever, I'm not sure something like this would increase the number of dodges that happen. In fact you might even see fewer - If I really dislike the look of our comp, I don't mind losing 3 LP. On the flip side, if I was out of free dodges and it was more like a 15-20 LP penalty I'd think twice about it.

Honestly I like your ideas a lot too. 

I don't think the problems you mention with earning free dodges are there though.  Maybe 5 Games is too few,  but let's say you need 20 Games in a row to earn a Dodge. You're not getting mid 20 Games in a row. Even if you like 3 roles, odds are you won't make 20 Games in a row if you Dodge when stuck in one of 2 roles you don't like.  You also aren't going to use a free Dodge because someone wants shen support or talon jungle or anything else that's simply not meta. Your only going to dodge and reset your counter when it's a really serious issue. You might not even Dodge a terrible troll if you're at 18/20 accumulated because you don't want to start over. So I'd say 20 is too high (let's say cap is 2) but 5 is too low. There is a middle ground where you can Dodge trolls but it isn't worth dodging anything off meta. Trolls also would probably not earn dodges as they won't get in to that many games. Although being able to report them (possibly if all 4 players report one person and no one else after game they don't earn a game towards their free Dodge). 

I really like keeping the pick order though. It sucks when you go from 1/2 to 5 because someone else dodged :(

Since you know you tend to play something off meta like revive tele yi and win by split pushing and it being off meta and all your team auto reports even though you are on a 100 game win streak since they think it's trolling when it's simply a playstyle they haven't seen and you haven't yet won them the game. Enjoy your ban good sir.

How about a vote to dodge? As in if 4 out of the 5 players agree that the game is worth dodging due to one troll, they can vote to dodge at no penalty. A lot of times people don't want to dodge because they don't want to wait 30 minutes if they already used their 5 minute dodge. If 4 out of 5 players decide the game is not worth playing at champ select, then allow them to make that decision right there.

I honestly like this idea the most. Riot doesn't need to devote manhours to keep it going--only to implement it. Plus it jibes well with their philosophy of 'Always For the Player' (which I totally just made up). If a majority agrees that the game is not worth playing, let them play a new one!

The fact that Riot doesn't already match players with others who are in series is an issue in itself. Just because a players chooses to play Ranked doesn't mean they are wanting to be competitive or cooperative with their teammates.

I feel there should really be more restrictions to Ranked play other than simply being level 30.

i had a first-picked-autolocked-jungle-teemo on one of my promotion series to s3

i was like "Really bruh...?"

Let's see... In order to attain promotion someone needs to win 3/4  or 4/6 games (counting a game that gets you to 100 LP and promos immediately after). That's dumb by itself - it requires a short term win rate of 75% or 66%. A person who can attain that amount of win rate consistently should be in Challenger in no time, hell, probably even in LCS.

And there are the trolls. We have no legitimate way to counter trolls in champ select. Say I've just reached my promos for Plat 1, and there is a troll in my first promo game. If I play I lose, if I dodge I lose automatically. So, counting game I played to get to 100 LP and 2 remaining promo games I'm required to have 3/3 wins - THAT'S A 100% SHORT-TERM WINRATE.

And they will continue to do it, as long as there is no way to beat them in champ select. No report option, no vote kick - it all gives the power to the trolls. Only way to report them is to painfully sit through a, say, 30-minute long game just for a report that *might* get them banned.
so what happened in your promo champ select?

I didn't take screenshots (which I probably should have done) so I don't remember their words verbatim but one player said something to the effect of "I haven't played in a month, I'm just here to screw around and be a gatekeeper". The other said "Hey some of you are in series - what to troll jungle with". Their picks were normal enough (one was Thresh support and the other was Shyvana jungle) but both wound up feeding to the nines, which didn't surprise me - it wasn't them getting outplayed, they just clearly didn't care and ran around picking fights they couldn't possibly win. The Thresh at the beginning of the game told the enemy team "be glad that i'm not on your team".

Starting a best of five with a guaranteed loss sucks.

As some guys mentioned, trolls will get free dodges as well. It sounds appealing on paper, but I know pretty much 90% of champion selects where there's a troll, the game is dodged (in my personal experience anyway). Sure, the 10% sucks, but it pretty much equals out when the troll is on the other team. 

**"Buh the troll is never on their team"**. My. @$&. Hole. You only notice your unlucky games. If you got lucky with a troll/afk on the other team, you don't remember it. You just remember going 9823892389/0/238998239823892398 and showing your "epic skillz" to your hormonal teenage friends. 

If I got trolls on my series on the other team from platinum to diamond, I'd be happy as hell. Yes, I'd prefer to win the series fair and square, but I wouldn't prefer to lose the series fair and square :)

Of course, I'm not against anti-trolls. I just think free dodge is bad. Most of this complaining is way out of line, because very few people have been the victim more than they've been the beneficiary. If @MuhPHDRiotLyte spent as much time against trolls as he did against toxics, this wouldn't be a problem. 

**So, if anything, ask for a better anti-troll system. One that should've come way before an automated Cry-bunal.** Lyte has posted that we're getting a better troll system, yet I still see the same (if not a bigger) amount of trolls in my games.
How about every game not just promos...

create a voting process. giving permissions to "trusted community players" can be too easily manipulated and deceived. when it comes to voting, its much safer as to the outcome.
 - voting step 1 - your team uses a vote just like surrender, which designates a specific player based on the popular vote.
 - voting step 2- a match-wide vote commences which also requires enemy team's input. you need at least 7 votes on a single person to count them as a griefer, which will trigger the following outcomes:
-- the griefer is banned for 1-week first time, permanent 2nd time.
-- *up for discussion* ... a victory given to both teams. or, prevented loss given to both teams. or, a victory given to winning team, a loss to losing team but no loss of LP will happen.

- voting step 2 (cont.) - if you do not get 7 votes, the fact that it went to a match-wide vote will put that match up for review to the tribunal system and you will have to wait patiently for a determination, and if so, the losing team will be refunded any lost LP for that match.
